item.title: Peter add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Peter add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Paradoxically though it may seem, it is none the less true that life imitates art far more than art imitates life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Peter add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "...it all, maybe, most likely, indeed, might turn out for the best." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Peter add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "This is God's universe, buddy, not yours, and he has the final say about what's ego and what isn't." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Peter add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "My whole wretched life swam before my weary eyes, and I realized no matter what you do it's bound to be a waste of time in the end so you might as well go mad." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Peter add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Things are so hard to figure out when you live from day to day in this feverish and silly world. " -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Peter add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Books, shmooks, this sickness has got me wishing if I can ever get out of this I'll gladly become a millworker and shut my big mouth." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Peter add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Sundown, yellow moon, I replay the past I know every scene by heart, they all went by so fast" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Peter add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "I find C major to be the key of strength, but also the key of regret. E major is the key of confidence. A-flat major is the key of renunciation." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Peter add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "I'm against nature. I don't dig nature at all. I think nature is very unnatural. I think the truly natural things are dreams, which nature can't touch with decay." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Peter add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "There are many here among us who feel that life is but a joke. But you and I, we've been through that, and this is not our fate, so let us not talk falsely now, the hour is getting late. " -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Peter add a quote by J.P. Donleavy
item.description: "Some day you’ll show up when I’m back where I belong in this world. When I have what I ought to have. My due. And when you do. My gamekeepers will drive you out and away for good. Out. Away. Out." -- J.P. Donleavy

item.title: Peter add a quote by Penelope Ashe
item.description: "If a community bends over backward to be publicly liberal, it can give itself the bonus of private snobbery." -- Penelope Ashe

item.title: Peter add a quote by John Darnielle
item.description: "I don't even want to be rich I just want to be alone. " -- John Darnielle

item.title: Peter add a quote by John Darnielle
item.description: "I wish they'd conduct a national poll to find out who feels out of place and who doesn't. Just to get the numbers, you know? To get a feel for how many of us there are." -- John Darnielle

item.title: Peter add a quote by John Darnielle
item.description: "People always talk about good time rock and roll, Chuck Berry or whatever, like this liberating force for feeling good. But what I need in my life is to be liberated into feeling bad. Not sad. I have plenty of sad. What I need is a place where I can spray anger in sparks like a gnarled piece of electrical cable. Just be mad at stuff and soak in the helplessness. " -- John Darnielle

item.title: Peter add a quote by John Fante
item.description: "I have wanted women whose very shoes are worth all I have ever possessed." -- John Fante

item.title: Peter add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "In a closed society where everybody's guilty, the only crime is getting caught. In a world of thieves, the only final sin is stupidity." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Peter add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Poetry, the best of it, is lunar and is concerned with the essential insanities. Journalism is solar (there are numerous newspapers named The Sun, none called The Moon) and is devoted to the inessential. " -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Peter add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Leave it to a naive world-saver like you to view our love as a Sacred Cause when in actual fact all it was was some barking at the moon." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Peter add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "As they say in my country, have a nice day." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Peter add a quote by Eugène Ionesco
item.description: "Politicians are either there or here or totally at home. Their finitude is more than sufficient unto itself. I don’t mean to imply that I’m any better than they which does not mean that they are any better than I. Which doesn’t mean anything at all." -- Eugène Ionesco

item.title: Peter add a quote by J.P. Donleavy
item.description: "Not using that handy maxim a man is what he makes his dough at and alas how much. Sometimes it is a gentle gesture to remind people of their big time possibilities. Makes them like you." -- J.P. Donleavy

item.title: Peter add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The only difference between the Adamic man and the man of today is that the one was born to Paradise and the other has to create it. " -- Henry Miller

item.title: Peter add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "Night was coming on in, borrowing the light. It had started out borrowing just a few cents worth of the light, but now it was borrowing thousands of dollars worth of the light every second. The light would soon be gone, the bank closed, the tellers unemployed, the bank president a suicide." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Peter add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "I have never voted in my life... I have always known and understood that the idiots are in a majority so it's certain they will win." -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline

item.title: Peter add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Celine
item.description: "To hell with reality! I want to die in music, not in reason or in prose. People don't deserve the restraint we show by not going into delirium in front of them. To hell with them!" -- Louis-Ferdinand Celine
